DataElement.preferredName: Cell Preparation Tube PBMC Freezing Initiation Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time at which Cell Preparation Tube (CPT) Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell (PBMC) freezing was initiated.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cell Preparation Tube Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell Freezing Initiation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of mononuclear cells._A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes._The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase._The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of mononuclear cells.

Concepts.definition: An evacuated blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin, intended for the collection of whole blood and the separation of mononuclear cells.

Property.preferredName: Peripheral Blood Mononuclear Cell Freezing Initiation
Property.preferredDefinition: A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.:The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.:The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

Concepts.definition: A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.
The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.
The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
